title: Drug trafficker sentenced to 15 years RI for attempted murder of police officer
byline: A suspected drug trafficker was sentenced to 15 years of rigorous imprisonment by Colombo High Court Judge Lanka Jayaratne yesterday (02) for attempting to kill a Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) officer during a drug raid in the Nedimala area of Dehiwala more than 17 years ago.

title: Sri Lankan student whose bank account was used in fake bulk order scams gets jail in Singapore
byline: A foreign student in need of money sold her bank account details and it was later used to funnel almost S$18,000 (US$13,980) in scam proceeds, with most of the money coming from a fake Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) bulk order scam.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology announced that atmospheric conditions are becoming favorable for evening thundershowers in most parts of the island.

title: Putin praises Trump but warns supplies of US long-range missiles to Ukraine will badly hurt ties
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the United States that supplies of long-range missiles to Ukraine will seriously damage relations between Moscow and Washington but will not change the situation on the battlefield, where the Russian army is making slow but steady advances.

title: 4 arrested for smuggling goods including mobile phones worth over Rs. 10 mln
byline: Maligawatta Police have arrested four individuals in connection with a consignment of mobile phones, perfumes, and accessories worth over Rs. 10 million, allegedly smuggled into the country through Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, without paying customs duties.

title: Exam Dept. issues notice on 2025 O/L exam applications
byline: The Department of Examinations announced that the online application period for students sitting for the 2025 (2026) G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination will close on October 9.

title: Drone sightings disrupt Munich airport, halt flights and impact thousands
byline: Germany’s Munich airport said early on Friday that drone sightings on Thursday evening had forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers.

title: Liquor shops to remain closed today for World Temperance Day
byline: The Department of Excise in Sri Lanka has announced that all wine stores and liquor sales outlets across the island will remain closed today (October 3), in view of the World Temperance Day.

title: AG to file indictments against ‘Dambulla Thunders’ owner in LPL match-fixing case
byline: The Police Unit for the Prevention of Sports-Related Offences Unit informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (03) that the Attorney General has decided to file indictments against Tamim Rahman,...

title: Calls for PC polls aim to show public opinion on govt – Mahinda Deshapriya
byline: Former Election Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya stated that the current calls for Provincial Council elections are being made merely to demonstrate that there is public opposition to the incumbent government.

title: ASPI crosses 22,000 for the first time
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) surpassed the 22,000-point mark for the first time in history, during this morning’s (03) trading session.

title: Manusha’s anticipatory bail application fixed for consideration
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered that the anticipatory bail application filed by former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, seeking his release on anticipatory bail before he is arrested by the Bribery Commission, be taken up for consideration on October 08.

title: Peaky Blinders to return to TV with gang’s new era
byline: Peaky Blinders is to return to TV to follow the exploits of a new generation of the Shelby family after World War Two.

title: One killed, 5 injured as van crashes into tree in Thanamalwila
byline: A person was killed and five others injured in a fatal road accident that occurred in the Kithulkote area along the Thanamalwila–Wellawaya road this morning (October 3).

title: Navy arrests two suspects with illegal gold stock in Kalpitiya
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has arrested two individuals in possession of an illegal stock of gold during a special search operation in the Arachchal sea area of Kalpitiya.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: New program to monitor performance of each state institution for one year: COPE Chairman
byline: A special awareness workshop was held in Parliament for the heads of 457 state institutions that fall under the oversight of the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE).

title: Wild elephant killed in train collision in Habarana
byline: A wild elephant was struck and killed by a fuel train near the 137 ½ Mile Post on the Eastern Railway Line, between Habarana and Hatares Kotuwa stations, today (03).

title: Fire breaks out at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery in Los Angeles
byline: A fire broke out at Chevron’s El Segundo refinery, one of the largest on the U.S. west coast, California Governor Gavin Newsom’s press office said on Thursday, with a county official adding that the flames had been confined to one area.

title: President Anura Kumara presents ‘Sannas Pathra’ to new Asgiri Anunayake Thero
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has officially presented the Sannas Pathra (letter of appointment) to the newly appointed Anunayake Thero of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Maha Nikaya, Most Venerable Narampanawe Ananda Thero, at the historic ‘Magul Maduwa’ on the premises of the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: UK names Mullally as first female Archbishop to lead Church of England
byline: Britain appointed Sarah Mullally as the new Archbishop of Canterbury on Friday, the first time a woman has been named leader of the Church of England in the 1,400 year history of the role.

title: 5G technology will serve as key pathway for Sri Lanka’s economic growth - Deputy Minister
byline: At a special media briefing held today (03) at the Information and Communication Technology Agency, the Notice of Assignment (NoA) required for the 2025 frequency auction of 5G was officially announced.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ released
byline: Superstar Taylor Swift’s 12th studio album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” arrived on Friday with a promotional blitz including midnight sales at Target stores, a release party at movie theaters around the globe and pop-up experiences in New York and Los Angeles.

title: New laws not intended for personal gain; focus is common good – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today offered a response to the joint letter by the Chief Prelates of the three Buddhist Chapters warning that the proposed Penal Code amendment criminalizing corporal punishment and alleged initiatives promoting LGBTQ-related tourism could undermine cultural values and trigger serious social crises.

title: Luxembourg’s grand duke abdicates after 25 years, passing throne to son
byline: Luxembourg’s Grand Duke Henri abdicated his throne on Friday in favour of his son, Guillaume. Henri, 70, had served the tiny duchy in the heart of Europe for 25 years in a largely symbolic role.

title: President meets Chief Prelates of Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake called on the Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters today (03) and received their blessings.

title: Court grants permission to detain and question ‘Beliatte Sana’
byline: The Tangalle Magistrate’s Court has granted permission for police to detain and interrogate Sanath Weerasinghe, also known as ‘Beliatta Sanaa,’ who was arrested in connection with the large haul of narcotics recently seized in Seenimodara, Tangalle.

title: Sri Lanka establishes diplomatic relations with Antigua and Barbuda
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Antigua and Barbuda have established Diplomatic Relations between the two countries with immediate effect, upon the signing of the agreement on Friday (03).

title: USS Fitzgerald makes port call in Colombo
byline: USS Fitzgerald (DDG 62) of the United States Navy arrived at the port of Colombo on replenishment purposes this morning (03).

title: Trump sets Sunday night deadline for Hamas to back Gaza plan
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump gave Hamas until Sunday evening to reach a last-chance agreement on his plan for Gaza’s future or have “all Hell” break out against the Palestinian militants.
